t: Luke 21
The Widow’s Gift
He*p looked up and saw the rich dropping their offerings into the temple treasury.
He also saw a poor widow dropping in two tiny coins.
“Truly*r I*r tell*r you,”*r he said, “this*r poor*r widow*r has*r put*r in*r more*r than*r all*r of*r them.*r
For*r all*r these*r people*r have*r put*r in*r gifts*r out*r of*r their*r surplus,*r but*r she*r out*r of*r her*r poverty*r has*r put*r in*r all*r she*r had*r to*r live*r on.”*r
Destruction of the Temple Predicted
As*p some were talking about the temple, how it was adorned with beautiful stones and gifts dedicated to God, he said,
“These*r things*r that*r you*r see -*r the*r days*r will*r come*r when*r not*r one*r stone*r will*r be*r left*r on*r another*r that*r will*r not*r be*r thrown*r down.”*r
Signs of the End of the Age
“Teacher,”*p they asked him, “so when will these things happen? And what will be the sign when these things are about to take place?”
Then*p he said, “Watch*r out*r that*r you*r are*r not*r deceived.*r For*r many*r will*r come*r in*r my*r name,*r saying,*r ‘I*r am*r he,’*r and,*r ‘The*r time*r is*r near.’*r Don’t*r follow*r them.*r

When*r you*r hear*r of*r wars*r and*r rebellions,*r don’t*r be*r alarmed.*r Indeed,*r it*r is*r necessary*r that*r these*r things*r take*r place*r first,*r but*r the*r end*r won’t*r come*r right*r away.”*r
Then*p he told them, “Nation*r will*r be*r raised*r up*r against*r nation,*r and*r kingdom*r against*r kingdom.*r
There*r will*r be*r violent*r earthquakes,*r and*r famines*r and*r plagues*r in*r various*r places,*r and*r there*r will*r be*r terrifying*r sights*r and*r great*r signs*r from*r heaven.*r

But*r before*r all*r these*r things,*r they*r will*r lay*r their*r hands*r on*r you*r and*r persecute*r you.*r They*r will*r hand*r you*r over*r to*r the*r synagogues*r and*r prisons,*r and*r you*r will*r be*r brought*r before*r kings*r and*r governors*r because*r of*r my*r name.*r
This*r will*r give*r you*r an*r opportunity*r to*r bear*r witness.*r
Therefore*r make*r up*r your*r minds*r not*r to*r prepare*r your*r defense*r ahead*r of*r time,*r
for*r I*r will*r give*r you*r such*r words*r and*r a*r wisdom*r that*r none*r of*r your*r adversaries*r will*r be*r able*r to*r resist*r or*r contradict.*r
You*r will*r even*r be*r betrayed*r by*r parents,*r brothers,*r relatives,*r and*r friends.*r They*r will*r kill*r some*r of*r you.*r
You*r will*r be*r hated*r by*r everyone*r because*r of*r my*r name,*r
but*r not*r a*r hair*r of*r your*r head*r will*r be*r lost.*r
By*r your*r endurance,*r gain*r your*r lives.*r
The Destruction of Jerusalem
“When*rp you*r see*r Jerusalem*r surrounded*r by*r armies,*r then*r recognize*r that*r its*r desolation*r has*r come*r near.*r
Then*r those*r in*r Judea*r must*r flee*r to*r the*r mountains.*r Those*r inside*r the*r city*r must*r leave*r it,*r and*r those*r who*r are*r in*r the*r country*r must*r not*r enter*r it,*r
because*r these*r are*r days*r of*r vengeance*r to*r fulfill*r all*r the*r things*r that*r are*r written.*r
Woe*r to*r pregnant*r women*r and*r nursing*r mothers*r in*r those*r days,*r for*r there*r will*r be*r great*r distress*r in*r the*r land*r and*r wrath*r against*r this*r people.*r

They*r will*r be*r killed*r by*r the*r sword*r and*r be*r led*r captive*r into*r all*r the*r nations,*r and*r Jerusalem*r will*r be*r trampled*r by*r the*r Gentiles*r until*r the*r times*r of*r the*r Gentiles*r are*r fulfilled.*r
The Coming of the Son of Man

“Then*rp there*r will*r be*r signs*r in*r the*r sun,*r moon,*r and*r stars;*r and*r there*r will*r be*r anguish*r on*r the*r earth*r among*r nations*r bewildered*r by*r the*r roaring*r of*r the*r sea*r and*r the*r waves.*r
People*r will*r faint*r from*r fear*r and*r expectation*r of*r the*r things*r that*r are*r coming*r on*r the*r world,*r because*r the*r powers*r of*r the*r heavens*r will*r be*r shaken.*r
Then*r they*r will*r see*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r coming*r in*r a*r cloud*r with*r power*r and*r great*r glory.*r
But*r when*r these*r things*r begin*r to*r take*r place,*r stand*r up*r and*r lift*r your*r heads,*r because*r your*r redemption*r is*r near.”*r
The Parable of the Fig Tree
Then*p he told them a parable: “Look*r at*r the*r fig*r tree,*r and*r all*r the*r trees.*r
As*r soon*r as*r they*r put*r out*r leaves*r you*r can*r see*r for*r yourselves*r and*r recognize*r that*r summer*r is*r already*r near.*r
In*r the*r same*r way,*r when*r you*r see*r these*r things*r happening,*r recognize*r that*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r is*r near.*r
Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r this*r generation*r will*r certainly*r not*r pass*r away*r until*r all*r things*r take*r place.*r
Heaven*r and*r earth*r will*r pass*r away,*r but*r my*r words*r will*r never*r pass*r away.*r
The Need for Watchfulness
“Be*rp on*r your*r guard,*r so*r that*r your*r minds*r are*r not*r dulled*r from*r carousing,*r drunkenness,*r and*r worries*r of*r life,*r or*r that*r day*r will*r come*r on*r you*r unexpectedly*r
like*r a*r trap.*r For*r it*r will*r come*r on*r all*r who*r live*r on*r the*r face*r of*r the*r whole*r earth.*r

But*r be*r alert*r at*r all*r times,*r praying*r that*r you*r may*r have*r strength*r to*r escape*r all*r these*r things*r that*r are*r going*r to*r take*r place*r and*r to*r stand*r before*r the*r Son*r of*r Man.”*r
During*p the day, he was teaching in the temple, but in the evening he would go out and spend the night on what is called the Mount of Olives.
Then all the people would come early in the morning to hear him in the temple.
